name: API
description: The Flow Commerce REST API provides full access to the global ecommerce platform.

enums.name: adjustment_reason_key
enums.description: The key of each possible adjustment is defined here.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: If the duty de minimis value has not been met, an adjustment may be made to offset any previously calculated duty.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: If the VAT de minimis value has not been met, an adjustment may be made to offset any previously calculated VAT.

enums.name: aggregate
enums.description: The aggregate function to be applied

enums.name: attribute_data_type
enums.description: Used to tag attributes with a data type so they are properly validated.

values.name: boolean
values.description: Boolean true/false data type

values.name: decimal
values.description: Decimal datatype without size or precision restrictions. Commonly used for currency values.

values.name: string
values.description: Unvalidated string of characters.

enums.name: attribute_intent
enums.description: Used to tag attributes as having a specific meaning that can affect processing. For example, if you have an attribute called "brandname", and assign it the "brand" intent, the value of the "brandname" attribute will be used where a brand name is needed. Note that an intent can be assigned to any amount of attributes of an item.

values.name: brand
values.description: A brand name of the item (for retailers that sell multiple brands)

values.name: color
values.description: The color of the item

values.name: countries_of_origin
values.description: A space separate list of the countries of origin for this item

values.name: product_id
values.description: An identifier used to group items that are variations of the same product, such as different sizes or colors of the same shirt

values.name: fulfillment_method
values.description: Identifies whether the item is a physical or digital good

values.name: hazardous
values.description: Identifies whether this item may contain hazardous materials

values.name: price
values.description: A price for the item in the organization's base currency (will be localized based on each Experience's pricing policy)

values.name: size
values.description: A size label of the item

values.name: sku
values.description: An SKU for the item

values.name: taxability
values.description: Identifies whether taxes are applicable to an item

values.name: consumer_url
values.description: A URL of the product detail page of the item

values.name: gtin
values.description: The Global Trade Item Number of this item.

values.name: mpn
values.description: The Manufacturer Part Number of this item.

values.name: anonymous
values.description: No authentication necessary.

values.name: session
values.description: A browser has been assigned an identifier by flow to track their use of our service for an organization.

values.name: token
values.description: A token. Tokens carry the same permissions as the user who originally created them.

values.name: user
values.description: A user logs into Flow.

values.name: expired
values.description: Payment method has expired

values.name: invalid_name
values.description: Invalid card holder name

values.name: invalid_number
values.description: Invalid payment number

values.name: invalid_expiration
values.description: Invalid expiration date

values.name: invalid_address
values.description: Invalid billing address

values.name: invalid_token_type
values.description: Cannot create a permanent card via an unauthorized request

values.name: invalid_token
values.description: The provided card token is invalid or it does not exist.

values.name: no_account
values.description: The provided payment method is not known by the issuing bank (the account does not exist)

values.name: avs
values.description: Declined due to avs mismatch)

values.name: cvv
values.description: Declined due to cvv mismatch)

values.name: fraud
values.description: Declined due to suspected fraud

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Declined due to suspected duplicate transaction

values.name: not_supported
values.description: Declined as payment method is not supported

values.name: unknown

enums.name: authorization_option
enums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

enums.name: authorization_result_action_type
enums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

enums.name: available_filter_format
enums.description: The Available Filter Format defines the type of data that is expected in a single filter

values.name: date
values.description: Expects date in format YYYY-MM-DD

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

values.name: weekdays
values.description: Mon - Fri

values.name: everyday
values.description: 7 days per week

enums.name: cancel_reason
enums.description: The reason for a cancellation. Choice of a reason may change how and which parties are notified about a cancel.

values.name: out_of_stock
values.description: Out of stock is a permanent cancel of the fulfillment of an item qty. If no other fulfillment parties exist, this will cancel the ordered quantity and reduce or refund the consumer's payment.

values.name: consumer_requested
values.description: A consumer requested cancellation of an item qty and the fulfillment party has acknowledged that the qty will not be shipped. This is a cancel of the ordered quantity and will reduce or refund the consumer's payment

values.name: flow_cancel
values.description: Flow has had to cancel an order, possibly due to fraud activity or inability to collect payment. This will cancel the ordered quantity. All known parties will be notified.

values.name: unknown

values.name: failed

values.name: fraud

values.name: unknown

enums.name: consumer_invoice_document_type
enums.description: The invoice content type defines the type of content contained in a given url

values.name: pending
values.description: Indicates that the credit memo has been created but validation is pending (e.g. waiting for the associated refund to be confirmed)

values.name: available
values.description: Indicates that the credit memo is fully validated and available for the end consumer

values.name: invalid
values.description: Indicates that the credit memo failed to validate after multiple attempts and time

values.name: invalid_order_number
values.description: Indicates the specified order does not exist

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_description
values.description: Indicates that the description is invalid (must be non-empty)

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Indicates that a credit payment with the specified key already exists

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

enums.name: currency_label_formatter
enums.description: A currency label formatter accepts a price label and updates it according to a set of rules.

values.name: strip_trailing_zeros
values.description: If a price ends in '.00' or ',00', we remove the cents and just display the price as a whole number. e.g. 'A$100.00' becomes 'A$100'

enums.name: currency_symbol_format
enums.description: The currency symbol format controls which set of currency symbols we use when displaying currencies

values.name: narrow
values.description: The narrow format refers to the Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) 'narrow' symbols (e.g. '$' for CAD and AUD)

values.name: primary
values.description: The primary format refers to the Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) 'primary' symbols (e.g. 'CA$' for CAD and 'A$' for AUD)

values.name: match
values.description: CVV matches

values.name: suspicious
values.description: CVV did not match; Transaction is possibly fraudulent

values.name: unsupported
values.description: CVV did not match; Issuer does not support card verification numbers

values.name: no_match
values.description: CVV did not match; Specific reason not available

values.name: paid
values.description: Delivered Duty Paid (DDP). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incoterms for more information

values.name: unpaid
values.description: Delivered Duty Unpaid (DDU). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incoterms for more information

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: mixed
values.description: A delivery estimate may be a combination of multiple sources

values.name: outbound
values.description: Outbound shipment to typically fulfill a customer order

values.name: return
values.description: Inbound or return shipment

values.name: sandbox
values.description: In sandbox, no external services (e.g. orders, payments, logistics) will generate real transactions

values.name: production
values.description: In production, all external services are live and will generate real transactions

values.name: available
values.description: Inventory is generally available for purchase

values.name: low
values.description: Inventory is low and may soon become unavailable for purchase. Unless there is a specific use case for low inventory, it can be treated the same as 'available'

values.name: out_of_stock
values.description: There is no inventory available and is not available for purchase. Sample actions that can be taken are hiding the item or marking as `sold out` on the frontend

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

enums.name: export_status
enums.description: Export status is a finite state machine with valid transitions of created to processing, processing to completed or failed

enums.name: flow_addon_role

values.name: membership_manager
values.description: Can invite new users to the org.

values.name: flow_operations

enums.name: flow_behavior
enums.description: Behaviors represent cross-cutting concerns that may be assigned via roles and may apply to many API endpoints.

values.name: view_consumer_data

values.name: sku-attribute
values.description: A Flow catalog attribute named 'sku'

values.name: product_id-attribute

enums.description: Default user roles supported by Flow

values.name: organization_admin
values.description: Can fully administrate a merchant organization.

values.name: organization_merchant
values.description: Can access merchant functions such as analytics, billing, experiences.

values.name: organization_operations
values.description: Can access customer service functions and retreive relevant data.

values.name: partner_operations
values.description: Can operate a partner (distribution center) account with Flow.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'.

values.name: approved
values.description: Fraud check has passed and the order is approved.

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the fraud check has been declined by the fraud providing service.

values.name: review

enums.name: fulfillment_item_quantity_status
enums.description: Possible fulfillment statuses for a item quantity

values.name: new
values.description: Item may be shipped or cancelled

values.name: shipped
values.description: Item has been packaged for shipment; can no longer be cancelled.

values.name: cancelled
values.description: Item will not be fulfilled.

enums.name: fulfillment_method_type
enums.description: Used to indicate an item's fulfillment method type.

values.name: fulfillment_method
values.description: Indicates how an item will be shipped or fulfilled.  Acceptable values are defined by the 'fulfillment_method_value' enum.

enums.name: fulfillment_method_value
enums.description: Used to indicate an item's fulfillment method values.

values.name: digital
values.description: Indicates item will be fulfilled digitally and no shipment is required (e.g. Gift Card).

values.name: physical
values.description: Indicates item will be shipped in a physical package.

values.name: generic_error
values.description: Generic errors are the default type. The accompanying message will provide details on the failure.

values.name: client_error
values.description: A client error has occurred. This represents a misconfiguration of the client

values.name: server_error
values.description: A server error has occurred. The Flow tech team is automatically notified of all server errors

values.name: thumbnail
values.description: Thumbnail images identify the image to use when displaying products in the Flow Console.

values.name: checkout
values.description: Checkout images identify the item image to use when displaying the item in the context of a consumer checkout (e.g. cart, checkout page).

values.name: harmonization_codes
values.description: Provides upload of HS-6 and HS-10 codes for the items in a catalog

values.name: catalog_items
values.description: Provides bulk upsert of items into an organization's catalog.

values.name: customs_descriptions
values.description: Provides upload of customs descriptions for the products in a catalog.

values.name: customs_description_tariffs
values.description: Provides upload of customs descriptions and corresponding tariffs. These are independent of any catalog, product, or item.

values.name: item_form_overlays
values.description: Provides upload of item form overlays for the items in a catalog.

enums.name: included_levy_key

values.name: mpn

values.name: vat

enums.name: margin_type
enums.description: Either a fixed or percent adjustment applied to some amount.

values.name: fixed
values.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

values.name: percent
values.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

enums.name: merchant_of_record
enums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

enums.name: method
enums.description: The available methods by which we deliver each webhook event

enums.name: order_change_source
enums.description: The original source of a change. For example, if a retailer is cancelling on behalf of a customer request, the source is consumer, even though the merchant issues the change to Flow.

values.name: consumer
values.description: The party that placed an order

values.name: retailer
values.description: The party that owns the processing of the order

values.name: fulfillment
values.description: A party providing fulfillment for an order

values.name: flow
values.description: Flow may provide anti-fraud or payment services for an order

values.name: carrier
values.description: A party providing carriage for an order

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language
values.description: Indicates that the specified language code is not valid

enums.name: order_merchant_of_record
enums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

enums.name: order_payment_type
enums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: A general purpose adjustment applied to the order.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the duty de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duties_item_price
values.description: The duty owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: duties_freight
values.description: The duty owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: duties_insurance
values.description: The duty owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: vat_insurance
values.description: The VAT owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_duties_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_duties_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: vat_duties_insurance
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: item_price
values.description: The sum of the price of the order's items with their currency margins, percent margins, and fixed margins included.

values.name: item_discount
values.description: The sum of all discounts applied to the order's items.

values.name: rounding
values.description: The sum of any rounding applied to the order's items.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The insurance cost for the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The shipping cost for the order.

values.name: order_discount
values.description: A discount applied to the entire order.

values.name: subtotal_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to item price, margin and rounding made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_vat_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to VAT owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to duty owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: The details of any adjustments made to the order.

values.name: subtotal
values.description: The details of the subtotal for the order, including item prices, margins, and rounding.

values.name: vat
values.description: The details of any VAT owed on the order.

values.name: duty
values.description: The details of any duties owed on the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The details of shipping costs for the order.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The details of insurance costs for the order.

values.name: discount
values.description: The details of any discount applied to the order.

enums.name: order_status
enums.description: Indicates an order's status

values.name: deny
values.description: A denied payment method cannot be used for an organization in any experience.

values.name: google-tsv

values.name: google-xml

values.name: criteo-xml

values.name: invalid_amount
values.description: Amount is not valid (e.g. for merchant of record payments, the amount specified must match the order). This typically is handled by refreshing the order amount and reconfirming with the user as something has changed.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Currency is either not known or invalid (e.g. for merchant of record payments, the currency specified must match the order).

values.name: invalid_method
values.description: Invalid payment method

values.name: invalid_order
values.description: The specified order number was not found

values.name: invalid_customer
values.description: Customer information is invalid (e.g. email specified but not a valid email)

values.name: invalid_destination
values.description: Destination/shipping address is not valid

values.name: unknown

enums.name: payment_method_rule_content_key
enums.description: Indicates the intent of a given instance of payment method rule content.

enums.name: payment_method_type
enums.description: The payment method type defines at a high level different user experiences that are required to accept payment of this type. By enabling a payment method type, you are specifying that you have completed the integration and all payment methods of this type become available for offer to your users.

values.name: card
values.description: Represents all form of card payment (e.g. credit, debit, etc.)

values.name: online
values.description: Represents the most common form of alternative payment methods which require some degree of integration online (e.g. a redirect) to complete payment.

values.name: offline
values.description: Offline payment method types represent payments like Cash On Delivery which require offline collection

enums.name: permitted_http_method
enums.description: List of HTTP methods for which user permissions may be applied (OPTION for example is always permitted where CORS is enabled).

values.name: base_price
values.description: The base price of the item.

values.name: discount
values.description: A discount applied to the base price of the item.

values.name: currency_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price due to FX markup, as configured in the organization's currency settings.

values.name: percent_item_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price from a percent item margin. Negative amounts represent discounts.

values.name: fixed_item_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price from a fixed item margin. Negative amounts represent discounts.

values.name: duties_item_price
values.description: The duty owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: duties_added_margin
values.description: The duty owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: duties_rounding
values.description: The duty owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: duties_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment made if the item does not meet the duty de minimis rule.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: vat_added_margin
values.description: The VAT owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: vat_rounding
values.description: The VAT owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: vat_duties_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: vat_duties_added_margin
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: vat_duties_rounding
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment made if the item does not meet the VAT de minimis rule.

values.name: item_price_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to the item price as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: margins_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to the item margins as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: rounding_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to rounding as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: vat_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to VAT owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: vat_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to VAT on duties (e.g. VAT on duties on item price) owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to duty owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: item_price
values.description: The details of the item price.

values.name: margins
values.description: The details of any margins added to the item price.

values.name: vat
values.description: The details of any VAT owed on the item.

values.name: duty
values.description: The details of any duties owed on the item.

values.name: rounding
values.description: The details of any rounding added to the item.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: The details of any price adjustments due to sales margins. A negative value indicates a discount.

enums.name: promotion_trigger_type
enums.description: The Promotion Trigger Type defines the conditions we evaluate when deciding if a particular promotion should be applied to an order.

values.name: automatic
values.description: Automatic indicates the the promotion will be automatically applied to the order

values.name: order_subtotal
values.description: Order subtotal sets a minimum value - orders whose subtotal is greater than the minimum will have the promotion applied. A common use case is to offer free shipping to orders about 150 CAD.

values.name: invalid_amount

values.name: invalid_currency

values.name: no_remaining_balance

values.name: unknown

values.name: down

enums.name: rounding_type
enums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

enums.name: unit_of_measurement

values.name: millimeter

values.name: centimeter

values.name: cubic_inch

values.name: cubic_meter
values.description: The metric unit for volume quantities (m³).

values.name: gram

values.name: kilogram

values.name: meter

values.name: ounce

values.name: pound
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 453.59237 grams (avoirdupois pound, standard name lb).

Enables authorization via PayPal

types.description: Represents items that can be delivered electronically (e.g. a gift card delivered via email)
Represents items that are physical and require shipment

types.description: Trigger whenever an auth status changes (e.g. from pending to authorized). Common use case is to subscribe to this event to know when an auth is cleared from fraud review.

unions.name: inventory_strategy
unions.description: Types of rules used to apply on inventory to calculate available quantity

types.description: Enables backorders, setting an optional number of units that we allow for backorder. For example, a backorder w/ quantity 10 will enable selling until the actual inventory quantity is -10.

Treats inventory as available as long as the actual inventory quantity is > the specified quantity. A common use case is to set quantity to zero to indicate availability as long as there is at least 1 unit available.
Items affected with rules pursuing an unlimited strategy will always be available

models.name: card
models.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: last4

fields.name: name
fields.description: Cardholder name

fields.name: address
fields.description: Cardholder billing address

models.name: order
models.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: expires_at
fields.description: The date and time on which this order will expire unless submitted. Used only when the order status is 'open'. New orders will expire 1 hour after creation.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: The currently selected delivery option ids. These IDs represent the shipping tiers that the customer has chosen (e.g. standard or express) for each delivery. The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

models.name: webhook_delivery
models.description: A webhook delivery represents an event that matched a webhook's event types. Each delivery will be attempted one or more times subject to the settings of your webhook.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: status
fields.description: Represents status of this delivery. This is a finite state machine that starts in pending and moves to either failure or success

fields.name: next_attempt_at
fields.description: If the last delivery attempt was not successful, we schedule a retry automatically subject to the webhook settings. If there is a retry scheduled in the future, this field contains the timestamp on which the retry will be initiated.

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of events that will trigger data to be sent to the webhook url. You can specify either '*' to select all events, or specific event types as listed in the type 'event_type' (with optional trailing wildcards).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: headers
fields.description: The headers sent to the webhook URL

fields.name: method
fields.description: The HTTP method, should always be POST

fields.name: body
fields.description: The event data sent to the webhook URL

fields.name: status
fields.description: Represents status of request. This is a finite state machine that starts in pending and moves to either failure or success

fields.name: started_at
fields.description: The timestamp at which we started processing this request

fields.name: completed_at
fields.description: The timestamp at which we completed processing of this request

fields.name: duration_ms
fields.description: Duration of milliseconds of the request (completed_at - started_at). Will always be available if completed at is set

fields.name: response
fields.description: The response from the webhook URL

fields.name: error
fields.description: Any errors that may have occurred while attempting to send the request. E.g, dns resolution or gateway timeouts

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier

fields.name: request
fields.description: The id of the corresponding request

fields.name: headers
fields.description: The headers returned from the webhook URL

fields.name: body
fields.description: The first 1k of the content returned from the webhook URL. This is ignored by Flow but retained for your information.

fields.name: body_url
fields.description: If the returned body was > 1k, the full contents is stored at this URL.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The HTTP Status Code from the webhook URL

models.name: webhook_settings
models.description: Sets organization level settings to determine things like how many retries on delivery, how long we wait, etc. By default, we will attempt delivery up to 6 times, using exponential backoff with a see of 1 minute (60k ms) - which means that we will retry over the course of approximately an hour before giving up.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: The string used to sign webhook requests

fields.name: retry_max_attempts
fields.description: The maximum number of times to attempt a delivery until a successful response

fields.name: retry_sleep_ms
fields.description: The amount of time to wait in milliseconds between failed delivery attempts

fields.name: sleep_ms
fields.description: The amount of time to wait between successful delivery attempts. Note this is a global setting, and thus we recommend a low value such as 100ms

fields.name: postals
fields.description: Group of postal code prefixes included in this zone

fields.name: provinces
fields.description: Group of provinces included in this zone. Values should in ISO 3166-2 province code format.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The ISO 3166-3 country code. Case insensitive. See https://api.flow.io/reference/countries

resources.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

resources.description: Item Functions are javascript code used to calculate the localized price of an additional item. Each function can be associated with an optional query identifying the products to which the function applies. Flow selects the first function matching an item, then uses that function to calculate local prices whenever any data relevant to the item changes (e.g. on update in master catalog, on change in relevant exchange rate, etc.). Item functions are immutable once created.

resources.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

annotations.name: personal_data
annotations.description: Identifies a field that contains Personal Data, as defined by GDPR. By default, any field marked with this annotation will be kept for 1 year and will be purgeable upon request provided there are no incomplete business activities associated with it.

annotations.name: consumer
annotations.description: Identifies a field that contains data about a consumer [as opposed to an employee of Flow, an organization or a partner].

annotations.name: pci
annotations.description: Identifies a field that contains data that must be handled in a way that is compliant with the PCI standard.
